intro: Ophiorrhiza maquilingensis, commonly known as the Maquiling bush, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ophiorrhiza maquilingensis is also noted for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, making it an important component of tropical ecosystems.
